parse.title: List of disasters in Australia by death toll

text.*:
This article may require cleanup to meet Wikipedia's quality standards. The specific problem is: Citations many formatting errors Please help improve this article if you can. (September 2018) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)

This is a list of disasters and tragic events in modern Australia sorted by death toll.

Contents

  • 1 100 or more deaths
  • 2 50 to 99 deaths
  • 3 10 to 49 deaths
  • 4 Significant incidents resulting in fewer than 10 deaths
  • 5 Significant incidents of Australians being killed overseas
  • 6 See also
  • 7 References
  • 8 External links

100 or more deaths[edit]

Disaster Location Deaths Date Notes
Pandemic Australia-wide 12,000+ 1918–1920 1918 flu pandemic[1]
Epidemic Australia-wide 8,000+ 1875-1876 Scarlet fever epidemic.[2]
Sinking Near Rabaul, Papua New Guinea 1,054 1942 July 1 Japanese auxiliary ship SS Montevideo Maru loaded with Australian POWs sunk by American submarine USS Sturgeon which was unaware at the time that the ship was carrying Allied prisoners. Death toll included 845 military and 209 civilian. In addition, approximately 68 of the Japanese crew were also lost.[3]
Epidemic Australia-wide 1013 1946–1955 Polio epidemic.[4]
Sea battle Indian Ocean, near Shark Bay 727 1941 Nov 19 Battle between HMAS Sydney and German auxiliary cruiser Kormoran. Both ships sank; all 645 aboard Sydney were killed, along with 82 personnel from Kormoran.[5][6]
Epidemic Australia-wide 550 1900–1910 Bubonic plague.[7]
Heat wave Victoria 438 1938 Dec  – Feb 1939 Heatwave killed 438 and sparked the Black Friday bushfires (see below).[8]
Heat wave South-eastern Australia 437 1895–1896 Widespread heatwave killed 437, including 47 in Bourke, New South Wales.[9]
Cyclone Bathurst Bay, Queensland 410 1899 Mar 4 Cyclone Mahina; estimated toll.[10]
Shipwreck King Island, Tasmania 406 1845 Wreck of the Cataraqui – Australia's worst civil maritime disaster.[11]
Heat wave South-eastern Australia 374 2009 Jan 25 – 9 Feb A nine-day heatwave in early 2009 in which Adelaide recorded six consecutive days over 40 °C (104 °F), a high of 45.7 °C (114.3 °F) and a record overnight minimum of 33.9 °C (93.0 °F) on 28 January.[12][13] Sparked the Black Saturday bushfires (see below). Health authorities attribute 374 deaths to the heat wave[14]
Shipwreck coast near Murchison River, Western Australia 286 1712 Apr Sinking of Dutch ship Zuytdorp. There has been speculation that there were survivors, who may have been assisted by local Aborigines.[15][16]
Sinking Off North Stradbroke Island, Queensland 268 1943 May 14 Sinking of AHS Centaur. Hospital ship torpedoed by a Japanese submarine.[17]
Heat wave Southern states 246 1907 Dec  – Jan 1908 [18]
Air raids Darwin, Northern Territory 243 1942 Feb 19 First bombings of Darwin. The first Japanese air raids against Australia. The toll may have been higher because itinerants and Aborigines may be under-represented in the official count.[19]
Prison break Cowra, New South Wales 235–238 1944 Aug 5 Cowra breakout. Escape by Japanese POWs.[20][21]
Pandemic Australia-wide 234 1890 1889-90 flu pandemic [22]
Shipwreck King Island, Tasmania 224 1835 May 13 Neva[23][24]
Shipwreck Western Australia 212 1726 Aagtekerke. Possibly WA, but there is some doubt on this.[25]
Pandemic Australia-wide 191 2009 2009 flu pandemic in Australia. 191 confirmed deaths. Death toll possibly as high as 1600.
Shipwreck Ledge Point, Western Australia 186 1656 Apr Vergulde Draeck[26]
Bushfires Victoria 180 2009 Feb Black Saturday bushfires[27]
Cyclone/sinking Western Australia 149 1912 Mar 1 SS Koombana[28][29]
Heatwaves Australia-wide 147 1920–1921 [30]
Heatwaves Australia-wide 143 + 1911–1912 [31]
Cyclone Broome, Western Australia 141 1935 Mar Pearling fleet devastated[32]
Cyclone Eighty Mile Beach, Western Australia 140 1884 Pearling fleet sunk[33]
Shipwreck D'Entrecasteaux Channel, Tasmania 133 1835 Apr 12 George III[34]
Shipwreck Cape York, Queensland 133 1890 Feb 28 RMS Quetta[35]
Heatwave Southern states 130 1926–1927 [36]
Shipwreck/mutiny/
massacre		 Abrolhos Islands, Western Australia 125+ 1629 Jun–Jul Wreck of the Dutch ship Batavia, after which mutineers murdered 125 passengers. This toll does not include the mutineers, seven of whom were hanged and two cast away after the remaining passengers had been rescued. Most of the remaining mutineers were later executed.[37]
Heatwave Australia-wide 122 + 1913–1914 [38]
Cyclone/sinking North-eastern Queensland 122 1911 Mar 16 SS Yongala[39]
Shipwreck Sydney, New South Wales 121 1857 Aug 20 Dunbar. 1 survivor.[40]
Heatwave Australia-wide 112 1939–1940 [41]
Heatwave Australia-wide 109 1909–1910 [42]
Heatwave Southern regions, Australia 105 + 1959 One source puts death toll at 145[43][44][45]
Cyclone/sinking Ayr, Queensland 102–112 1875 Feb 24 SS Gothenburg. Records of passengers vary[46][47][48]

  • The Centaur memorial, in Point Danger, Coolangatta, Queensland, commemorates the sinking of the hospital ship AHS Centaur in 1943, which claimed 268 lives.

  • At least 243 people died in the Japanese air raids on Darwin in 1942.

  • Japanese prisoners of war practice baseball on the sports ground near their quarters, several weeks before the 1944 Cowra breakout, in which at least 235 people died.

50 to 99 deaths[edit]

Disaster Location Deaths Date Notes
Heatwave Southern regions Australia 99 1972 Dec–Feb 1973 [49]
Cyclone Northern Queensland 99 1934 Mar Cyclone and 9.1 m storm surge[50]
Explosion Mount Kembla, New South Wales 96 1902 Jul 31 Mount Kembla Mine disaster. Coal mine gas explosion[51]
Shipwreck Monte Bello Islands, Western Australia 93 1622 Apr 23 Tryall. Earliest recorded Australian shipwreck[52]
Flood Gundagai, New South Wales 89 1852 Jun 24 [53]
Shipwreck near Carpenter Rocks, in South East South Australia 89 1859 Aug 6 SS Admella.[54] South Australia's worst loss of life
Air raid Broome, Western Australia 88 1942 Mar 3 Air raid on Broome. Japanese fighter planes strafed the town. Official toll; may not include some refugees from the Dutch East Indies.
Rail accident Sydney, New South Wales 83 1977 Jan 18 Granville railway disaster. Derailment followed by bridge collapse
Sinking twenty miles south-east of Jervis Bay, New South Wales 82 1964 Feb 10 Melbourne–Voyager collision – HMAS Voyager sank after collision with HMAS Melbourne
Explosion Bulli, New South Wales 81 1887 Mar 23 Bulli Colliery coal mine gas explosion[55]
Shipwreck King Island, Tasmania 79 1874 May 23 British Admiral[56]
Cyclone Queensland coast, particularly Innisfail 77+ 1918 Mar 10 Cyclone and storm surge with death toll estimated between 77 and 100.[57]
Storms New South Wales between Port Stephens and Sydney 77 1866 Jul 12 60 lives lost on SS Cawarra alone.[58]
Explosion Mount Mulligan, Queensland 75 1921 Sep 19 Mount Mulligan coal dust explosion [59]
Bushfire Victoria and South Australia 75 1983 Feb 16 Ash Wednesday bushfires[60]
Shipwreck Green Cape 71 1886 May 31 Ly-Ee-Moon[61]
Bushfire Victoria 71 1939 Jan 13 Black Friday bushfires
Cyclone Darwin 71 1974 Dec 24 Cyclone Tracy destroys the city of Darwin. On 17 March 2005, a Northern Territory Coroner's Inquest outcome increased the official death toll from 65 to 71.[62]
Flood Clermont, Queensland 65 1916 Dec 27 [63]
Bushfire Tasmania 62 1967 1967 Tasmanian fires
Cyclone near Roebourne and Geraldton, Western Australia 61–71 1894 Estimated toll includes those lost at sea and those killed in flooding at Geraldton[64]
Shipwreck Houtman Abrolhos Islands, Western Australia 60 1727 Zeewyk. Approximate death toll[65]
Shipwreck Newcastle, New South Wales 60 1866 Jul 12 SS Cawarra;; sank during storm in Newcastle Harbour.
Bushfire Victoria 60 1926 Feb–Mar [66] Worst incident occurred at Warburton, Victoria on 14 Feb where 31 lives were lost.[67]
Cyclone Exmouth Gulf, Western Australia 59–69 1875–1876 Most casualties were at sea[68][69]
Shipwreck Mutton Bird Island, off the Shipwreck Coast of Victoria 53 1878 Jun 1 Loch Ard. Sources vary on exact death toll (2 survivors).[70][71]
Epidemic Southern States 51 1881–1885 Smallpox epidemic [72]
Bushfire Victoria 51 1943–1944 [73]
Shipwreck Brisbane, Queensland 50 1896 Feb Capsize of the ferry Pearl[74]
Cyclone Around Broome, Western Australia 50 1908 [75]

  • Cable drums blown 50 feet (15 m) from their foundations after the 1921 Mount Mulligan mine disaster, which claimed 80 lives.

10 to 49 deaths[edit]

[91][92]
Disaster Location Deaths Date Notes
Shipwreck Christmas Island, Christmas Island 48 2010
Cyclonic effects North coast, New South Wales 46 1923 [76]
Rail accident Sunshine, Victoria 44 1908 Sunshine rail disaster. Rear-end collision
Fire Queenstown, Tasmania 42+ 1912 1912 North Mount Lyell Disaster. Mine fire. True toll may be higher due to subsequent deaths from the effects of the fire[77]
Sinking Sydney 40–42 1927 Nov 3 Greycliffe disaster[78][79]
Shipwreck near Edithburgh, South Australia 40 1909 Jan 31 SS Clan Ranald[80][81]
Air disaster near Mackay, Queensland 40 1943 Jun 14 Bakers Creek air crash. USAAF B-17 Flying Fortress crashes shortly after take-off.[82]
Flooding Queensland 38 2010 Dec–Jan 2011 2010–11 Queensland floods. 38 confirmed deaths plus 6 people missing (presumed dead).
Shipwreck Cardwell, Queensland 36 1872 Shipwreck Maria. Some of the survivors were killed by Aborigines although others were helped[83][84]
Shipwreck Jervis Bay, New South Wales, 35 1876 Sep 1 The steamer Dandenong lost during severe storm.[85]
Shipwreck Cheviot Beach, Victoria 35 1887 Oct 20 SS Cheviot
Shipwreck near East New Britain 35 1914 Sep 14 HMAS AE1. Sank with all hands. The submarine was found during the 13th search mission near the Duke of York Islands in December 2017.
Flood Melbourne suburbs and Southern Victoria 35 1934 Nov 29–Dec 1 Torrential rainfall of up to 350 mm. Yarra River becomes raging torrent. Extensive damage with 35 dead, 250 injured, and 3,000 homeless.[86][87]
Bridge collapse Melbourne 35 1970 Oct 15 West Gate Bridge. 35 construction workers died due to a collapse during construction.[88] Australia's worst industrial accident.[89]
Road accident Kempsey, New South Wales 35 1989 Dec 22 Kempsey bus crash. Two tourist coaches collided head-on[90]
Shooting Port Arthur, Tasmania 35 1996 Apr 28 Port Arthur massacre.
Shipwreck near Southend, south east South Australia 31 1876 Jun 14 Geltwood. Wreck not found for two weeks. No survivors.[93][94]
Shipwreck off Wilsons Promontory in Bass Strait 31 1935 Dec 1 SS Paringa Sunk during storm while towing another vessel. All officers and crew lost.[95][96]
Insurrection Castle Hill, New South Wales 30* 1804 Mar 4 – 5 Castle Hill convict rebellion. An additional nine convicts were later executed for participating in the rebellion. *Exact death toll unknown, likely to be higher.[97] Memorial at Castle Hill gives a figure of 45 lives lost.[98]
Cyclone Queensland coast, particularly Mackay 30 1918 Jan Mackay Cyclone[57][99]
Fire Melbourne 30 1966 Aug 13 William Booth Memorial Home fire – Australia's deadliest building fire. Salvation Army home for destitute men.[100]
Air accident York near Perth 29 1950 Jun 26 1950 Australian National Airways Douglas DC-4 crash.[101]
Air accident Mackay 29 1960 Jun 10 Trans Australia Airlines Flight 538 crashed into sea.
Cyclone/sinking. Western Australia 29 1991 Apr Cyclone Fife. 27 lost in shipwreck of Mineral Diamond[102][103]
Massacre Myall Creek, near Inverell, New South Wales 28 1838 Jun 9 Myall Creek massacre. 28 Aboriginal people killed by white stockmen[104]
Riot and insurrection Ballarat, Victoria 28 1854 Dec 3 Eureka Stockade. 28 confirmed, exact death toll remains unknown, could possibly be as high as 80.
Cyclone Darwin, Northern Territory 28 1897 Jan [105][106]
Shipwreck Kangaroo Island, South Australia 27 1905 Sep Loch Vennachar[107]
Sea battle Port Jackson 27 1942 May 31–1 Jun Attack on Sydney Harbour. Japanese submarine attack on allied shipping. Death toll includes attackers.
Air accident Cleveland Bay, Townsville, Queensland 27 1943 Aug 7 C-47 Dakota plane crash. Plane crashed after takeoff.[108]
Shipwreck/massacre Coorong, South Australia 26 1840 Maria. Survivors murdered.[109][110] Brutal punitive expedition ordered by Governor Gawler.
Explosion Wagga Wagga, New South Wales 26 1945 May 21 Kapooka Army Base soldiers received instruction of demolition work in a bunker which was 3 metres (9.8 ft) below the ground when an explosion took place which resulted in Australia's largest military funeral.[111][112]
Cyclone Gold Coast and northern New South Wales 26 1954 Feb [113]
Air accident Port Hedland, Western Australia 26 1968 Dec 31 In-flight break up of MacRobertson Miller Airlines Flight 1750 (Vickers Viscount)[114]
Rail accident Wodonga, Victoria 25 1943 Train hit bus carrying army personnel[115]
Air accident Seven-Mile Beach, near Hobart 25 1946 Mar 1946 Australian National Airways DC-3 crashed into the sea.[43]
Flood Hunter Valley, New South Wales 25 1955 Feb 1955 Hunter Valley floods. Most deaths were around Singleton and Maitland, but most other river systems in the state were also in flood.[116][117]
Shipwreck Gosford 24 1898 May 6 Maitland[118]
Air accident Winton, Queensland 24 1966 Sep 22 Ansett-ANA Viscount disaster. Flight 149 en route Mount Isa – Longreach
Air accident Kudjeru Gap, in the Australian Territory of Papua and New Guinea 24 1972 Aug RAAF Caribou aircraft crashes in rugged mountainous country en route from Lae to Port Moresby, killing 24 of the 28 people on board.
Bushfire Southern regions of Victoria 23 1969 Jan 280 fires. 17 casualties at Lara[119]
Mine disaster Creswick, Central Victoria 22 1882 Dec 12 New Australasia gold mine. 44 miners trapped when a flooded mine shaft is breached. 22 men drown.[120]
Flood Northern Tasmania 22 1929 Apr Eight drowned when truck ploughed into river and 14 died when dam collapsed and wall swept into town[121]
Heatwave South-east Queensland 22 2000 Jan [122]
Shipwreck off Gabo Island, Bass Strait 21 1901 Mar 1 SS Federal vanished without trace. All crewmembers lost.[123][124]
Air accident Coolangatta, Queensland 21 1949 Mar 10 1949 Queensland Airlines Lockheed Lodestar crash – aircraft crashed shortly after take-off due to incorrect loading.[125]
Shipwreck Smokey Cape, New South Wales 21 1969 Aug 25 Noongah sank
Road accident Grafton, New South Wales 21 1989 Oct 20 Grafton bus crash. A head-on collision between a tourist coach and a truck.[126]
Air accident Mossman, Queensland 20 1944 Sep 7 Royal Netherlands East Indies Air Force Douglas C-47 Dakota crashes en route between Merauke, Dutch East Indies and Cairns.
Shipwreck Trial Bay, New South Wales 19–21 1816 Sep [127]
Fire Kings Cross, New South Wales 19 1981 Aug 25 Rembrandt Hotel.[128]
Shipwreck Adelaide, South Australia 18 1888 Jul 13 Star of Greece was driven aground in a storm 200 yards from the beach at Port Willunga, ten survivors.[129]
Air accident Dandenongs, Victoria 18 1938 Oct 25 1938 Kyeema crash
Air accident Perth Airport 18 1949 Jul 2 1949 MacRobertson Miller Aviation DC-3 crash – aircraft crashed a minute after take-off, killing all 18 people on board.[130]
Road accident Tumut Pond, New South Wales 18 1973 Sep 1 Brake failure caused bus to plummet into reservoir[131]
Air accident Townsville, Queensland 18 1996 Jun 12 Two Army Blackhawk helicopters collided[132]
Landslide Thredbo, New South Wales 18 1997 Jul 30 1997 Thredbo landslide
Rail accident Brooklyn, New South Wales 17 1944 Train ploughed into bus at Hawkesbury River station[133]
Rail accident Wasleys Crossing, near Gawler, South Australia 17 1970 Apr 12 Wasleys Crossing (Gawler) disaster. Bus collided with a passenger train[134]
Explosion Ipswich, Queensland 17 1972 Jul 31 Mine gas explosion in the Box Flat Colliery[135]
Heatwave South-Eastern regions, Australia 17 1993 Feb Possibility of additional unreported deaths[136]
Shipwreck Bass Strait Victorian coast 16 1934 Nov 29 SS Coramba left Warrnambool for Melbourne and was never seen again. Believed lost during storm.[137][138]
Rail accident Camp Mountain, Queensland 16 1947 May 5 Camp Mountain train disaster. A crowded picnic train derailed on bend
Fire Sylvania Heights, New South Wales 16 1981 Apr 29 Pacific Nursing Home fire.[139]
Boating accident Mornington Peninsula 15 1892 May 21 15 members of Mornington football team returning from match in Mordialloc in small fishing vessel Process were lost when their boat sank in bad weather. Only 4 bodies were recovered.[140]
Shipwreck near Cape Schanck, Victoria 15 1893 Dec 28 SS Alert
Air accident Botany Bay, New South Wales 15 1961 Nov 30 Ansett-ANA Flight 325 – Vickers Viscount aeroplane crash. All on board died.[141]
Fire Fortitude Valley, Queensland 15 1973 Mar 8 Whiskey Au Go Go fire. Arson
Fire Kings Cross, New South Wales 15 1975 Dec 25 Savoy Hotel fire. Arson[142]
Cyclone/sinking near Carnarvon, Western Australia 15 1979 Cyclone Hazel[143]
Heatwave South-eastern regions of Australia 15 1981 Feb [144]
Fire Childers, Queensland 15 2000 Jun Robert Long received a life sentence for starting the Childers Palace backpackers hostel fire[145][146]
Air accident Lockhart River, Queensland 15 2005 May 7 In the Lockhart River air disaster an aeroplane crashed on approach to land, killing all on board.[147]
Cyclone Townsville and Charters Towers, Queensland 14 1903 Mar 9 Cyclone Leonta killed 12 people in Townsville and 2 in Charters Towers and caused massive property damage across North Queensland[148]
Bushfire Dandenong Ranges and Lara, Victoria 14* 1962 Jan 14 – 16 Casualty numbers vary between 9,[149] 14,[43][150] and 32.[119][151]
Bushfires Sydney, Blue Mountains and Illawarra, New South Wales 14* 1968 Jan *Sources vary on death toll but most say 14.[152]
Cyclone Whitsunday Islands, Queensland 14 1970 Jan Cyclone Ada
Cyclone Brisbane, Queensland 14 1974 Jan 27 1974 Brisbane flood. Cyclone Wanda[153]
Explosion Appin, New South Wales 14 1979 Jul 24 Appin Colliery Gas Explosion during a planned ventilation change.[154]
Cyclone/flood Queensland, New South Wales 14 2017 Mar 27–1 Apr Cyclone Debbie causes severe flooding throughout Queensland and New South Wales, leaving behind severe damage.[155]
Explosion Wonthaggi, Victoria 13 1937 Feb 15 Dalyson Colliery[156]
Air accident Tamworth, New South Wales 13 1960 Jan [43]
Explosion Kianga, near Moura, Queensland 13 1975 Sep 20 Kianga Mine explosion[157]
Air accident Sydney Airport 13 1980 Feb 21 Light aircraft suffers engine failure[158]
Air accident near Alice Springs, Northern Territory 13 1989 Aug 13 1989 Alice Springs hot air balloon crash[159]
Earthquake Newcastle, New South Wales 13 1989 Dec 28 1989 Newcastle earthquake
Bushfire Victoria – Portland, Plenty Ranges, Westernport, Wimmera and Dandenong districts 12* 1851 Feb 6 "Black Thursday" bushfires. *Approximately 12 fatalities, one million sheep, thousands of cattle, 50,000 km² burnt.[160]
Flood Windsor, New South Wales 12 1867 Jun 21 12 members of the Eather family swept away in flood.[161]
Shipwreck Calgardup Bay, Western Australia 12 1876 Dec 1 SS Georgette[162]
Bushfire Gippsland, Victoria 12 1898 Feb 1 "Red Tuesday" bushfires. 2,600 km² burnt, 12 people killed, 2,000 buildings destroyed.[160]
Bridge collapse Hobart, Tasmania 12 1975 Jan 5 Tasman Bridge disaster. The bulk ore carrier Lake Illawarra collided with the bridge, causing a section to fall onto the vessel. 7 crewmen died as the ship sank. 5 people perished as their cars plummeted off the edge.
Air accident Adavale, Queensland 12 1983 Aug 28 Charter flight broke up in flight and crashed.
Explosion Moura, Queensland 12 1986 Jul 16 Explosion in Moura No 4 Mine[163]
Fire Dungog, New South Wales 12 1991 Aug 2 Palm Grove Hostel fire[164]
Serial killing Remains discovered in Snowtown, South Australia 12 1992–1999 Snowtown murders.[165]
Road accident Boondall, Queensland 12 1994 Oct 1 Boondall bus crash[166]
Rail accident Near Horsham, Victoria 11 1951 Feb 24 A train collides with a bus at a level crossing.[167]
Air accident Mount Emerald, Queensland 11 1990 May 11 Cessna 500 jet aircraft collided with terrain 15 km south of Mareeba Airfield.[168]
Explosion Moura, Queensland 11 1994 Aug 7 Explosion in Moura No 2 Mine[169]
Rail accident Near Kerang, Victoria 11 2007 Jun 5 Kerang train crash. A V/Line train collides with a truck at a level crossing.[170]
Fire Kingston, Queensland 11 2011 Aug 24 House fire[171]
Fire Quakers Hill, New South Wales 11* 2011 Nov 18 Quakers Hill Nursing Home fire. As of 9 January 2012, NSW health officials claimed a total of 21 out of 96 residents died but police could only conclusively prove 11 perished directly as a result of the fire.[172][173]
Shipwreck Warrnambool, Victoria 10 1921 Jan 9 Motorlaunch Nestor sinks in the Hopkins River at Warrnambool, Victoria 10 minutes into a pleasure cruise. Of the 80 on board 10 were drowned. Victoria's worst ferry disaster.
Road accident Wangaratta, Victoria 10 1993 Nov 2 Crash between a semi-trailer truck and a bus on Melbourne Cup Day 1993. 10 members of the Anglo-Indian Association died when their bus heading to Corowa for a Melbourne Cup outing collided with a car-carrier semi trailer.
Heatwave Eastern and Southern regions Australia 10+ 1997 Jan – Feb Strong likelihood of additional unreported deaths[174]
Rail accident Near Traveston railway station, Queensland 10 1925 Jun 9 10 died and 48 injured when a passenger carriage and luggage van of the Rockhampton Mail plunged off a high trestle bridge.[175]
Air accident Canberra 10 1940 Aug 13 Senior War Cabinet Ministers, Chief of Staff and others killed when their plane crashed in fine weather.
Bushfire Wangaratta, Victoria 10 1943 Dec 22 Out-of-control grassfires during severe drought.[67]
Air accident Near Redesdale, Victoria 10 1945 Jan 31 Crash of Stinson Tokana caused by fatigue crack in wing spar.
Massacre South Australia 10 1971 Sep Clifford Bartholomew, Father, kills 10 members of his family[176]
Air accident Near Leonora, Western Australia 10 1988 Dec 16 Mitsubishi MU-2 accident.[177]
Storm/flood Hunter and Central Coast regions, New South Wales 10 2007 Jun 8 – 11 Storm and flooding[178]

  • The Port Arthur massacre claimed 35 lives in 1996 when Martin Bryant opened fire in the former penal colony.

  • Two Australian Army S-70A Blackhawk helicopters, similar to the one pictured, crashed in 1996 near Townsville, killing 18 Australian soldiers.

  • A memorial stone to some of those who died during the Eureka Stockade in 1854.

  • The 1950 Australian National Airways Douglas DC-4 crash claimed 29 lives.

  • The 1946 Australian National Airways DC-3 crash claimed 25 lives.

Significant incidents resulting in fewer than 10 deaths[edit]

Disaster Location Deaths Date Notes
Bushfire Gippsland, Victoria 9 1932 Feb 4 Locations affected included Gilderoy, Noojee and Erica in North Gippsland. Worst incident was at Erica where six people were killed.[179]
Bushfire Longwood, Victoria 9 1965 Jan 17–19 Death toll included seven members of one family who were lost when their car crashed and was engulfed in the fires.[180]
Rail accident Violet Town, Victoria 9 1969 Feb 7 Violet Town rail accident. Head-on collision after driver died at controls.[181]
Fire Kings Cross, New South Wales 9 1981 Aug Rembrandt Apartments Hostel Fire. Fire.[182]
Massacre Melbourne 9 1987 Dec 8 Queen Street massacre. Shooting massacre
Air accident Williamtown, New South Wales–Lord Howe Island 9 1994 Oct 2 Seaview Air Aero Commander 690 crashes between Williamtown, NSW and Lord Howe Island.[183]
Fire Kew, Victoria 9 1996 Apr 8 Kew Cottages fire. Fire at a Melbourne home for the disabled kills nine men. Coronial inquest in 1997 finds there was no proper fire safety system in place at the time of the fire.
Landslide Gracetown, Western Australia 9 1996 Sep 27 5 adults and 4 children died when a cliff face collapsed at Cowaramup Bay near Gracetown (Margaret River)[184][185]
Bushfire Eyre Peninsula, South Australia 9 2005 Jan 11 Eyre Peninsula bushfire.[186]
Storm Melbourne, Victoria 9 2016 Nov 21 Nine people died of thunderstorm asthma and approximately 8,500 sought hospital treatment after a storm hit Melbourne.[187][188]
Insurrection Norfolk Island 8 1834 Jan 15 Convict mutiny. Six convicts and two guards killed. 11 convicts were later executed.[189]
Civil unrest Broome, Western Australia 8 1920 Dec 23–26 Broome Race Riots. Brawling and rioting between Japanese and Koepanger (Malay & Timorese) pearl divers.[190]
Air accident Snowy Mountains, New South Wales 8 1931 Mar 21 Southern Cloud
Air accident Jervis Bay, New South Wales 8 1943 Apr 14 Two RAAF Bristol Beauforts collided whilst performing demonstration flight for war correspondents on board a naval vessel.[191]
Bushfire Wandilo, South Australia 8 1958 Apr 8 firefighters died[192]
Bushfire Western Victoria 8 1977 Feb Around Streatham was the worst affected area.[193]
Road accident Near Gordonvale, Queensland 8 1987 Feb 4 Bus returning from school camp veered off-road. All of those lost were students of Cairns State High School aged 15–17. 12 more people were seriously injured. Subsequent inquests ruled that faulty brakes on the vehicle were the cause of the accident.[194]
Air accident Off Whyalla, South Australia 8 2000 May 31 Whyalla Airlines Disaster. All on board drowned, one body was never recovered.
Explosion Off Dampier, Western Australia 8 2001 Nov 18 Nigo Kim cargo ship explosion.[195]
Massacre Manoora, Cairns, Queensland 8 2014 Dec 19 Cairns child killings. Eight children were fatally stabbed in a Murray Street residence.[196]
Serial killing Near Berrima, New South Wales 7+ 1989–1994 Backpacker Murders. The remains of seven backpackers found in the Belanglo State Forest; the killer remains the prime suspect for another 16 unsolved murders and is a person of interest for another 14. There is evidence he may not have acted alone.
Mine disaster Collinsville, Queensland 7 1954 Oct 13 On 13 October 1954, seven men were killed in the deepest part of the Collinsville State Coal Mine about 1.5 kilometres from the entrance of the No. 1 tunnel, when an outburst dislodged 900 tonnes of earth.[197] The Collinsville mine disaster was the largest loss of life in a Queensland mine since the Mount Mulligan mine disaster in 1921.[198]
Boating accident Wilson Inlet, Western Australia 7 1911 Nov 5 Seven members of the same family drowned when a small yacht Litle Wonder was hit by a squall.[199]
Boating accident Lake Hume, New South Wales 7 1963 Aug 15 Canoeists on Outward Bound outdoor education trip drowned when their canoes capsized in rough weather and in cold waters.[194]
Flood Canberra 7 1971 Jan 26 1971 Canberra flood. Seven motorists were killed when their cars were swept into a creek.[43]
Serial killing Near Truro, South Australia 7 1976–1977 Truro murders. Remains of seven young women found in bushland.
Fire Sydney 7 1979 Jun 9 Fire engulfs the Ghost Train ride at Luna Park Sydney. May have been arson.[200]
Air accident Near Charleville, Queensland 7 1981 Sep 19 Cessna U206 accident.[201]
Massacre Milperra, New South Wales 7 1984 Sep 2 Milperra massacre. Shooting massacre
Massacre Clifton Hill, Victoria 7 1987 Aug 9 Hoddle Street massacre. Shooting massacre
Flood Queensland, New South Wales and Victoria 7 1990 Nyngan and Charleville Flood. More than a million square kilometres of flooding.[202]
Air accident South Stradbroke Island, Queensland 7 1991 Mar 3 Sea World helicopter accident.[203]
Massacre Strathfield, New South Wales 7 1991 Aug 17 Strathfield massacre. Shooting massacre
Massacre Terrigal, Central Coast NSW 7 1992 Central Coast massacre. Shooting massacre
Air accident Young, New South Wales 7 1993 Jun 11 Piper PA-31-350 Chieftain plane crash.[204]
Massacre Hillcrest, Queensland 7 1996 Jan 25 Peter May killed his estranged wife, three children and parents-in-law before committing suicide.[205]
Cyclone Around Cairns, Queensland 7 1997 Mar Cyclone Justin. 1 death from landslide. There were also 26 deaths from the same cyclone in Papua New Guinea.[206]
Rail accident Glenbrook, New South Wales 7 1999 Dec Glenbrook train disaster. Collision by a CityRail Intercity train into the rear wagon of an Indian Pacific train after "Stop and Proceed".
Heatwave around Adelaide, South Australia 7 2000 Feb [207]
Rail accident Waterfall, New South Wales 7 2003 Jan Waterfall rail accident. Excessive speed resulting in derailment after driver died at the controls and 'dead man' safety device failed to function.[208]
Massacre Osmington, Western Australia 7 2018 May 11 Osmington shooting. Three adults and four children were shot dead in an alleged murder-suicide on a rural property.[209]
Industrial accident Spotswood, Victoria 6 1895 Spotswood Sewer Disaster. The drilling of an underground sewer in Melbourne went too close to the Yarra River.[210]
Massacre Alligator Creek near Mackay, Queensland 6 1911 Nov 17 A mother and five children were murdered in their home.[211]
Battle Broken Hill, New South Wales 6 1915 Jan 1 Battle of Broken Hill. Two Indian immigrants open fire on a train carrying picnickers.[212]
Landslide Between Blackwood, South Australia and Belair, South Australia 6 1928 Jan 31 Hills Railway line disaster. Railway embankment collapsed during tunnel demolition.[213]
Air Raid Drysdale Mission, Northern Territory 6 1943 Sep 26 Missionary Priest & five Aboriginal children killed in Japanese bombing raid on RAAF aerodrome located beside the Mission.[214]
Flood Kempsey, Macleay Valley 6 1949 Aug 26 Six people died in the flood, five in Kempsey. A 13-year-old boy at Smithtown[215]
Air accident East Sale, Victoria 6 1962 Aug 15 Four RAAF Vampire jets crashed in a military gunnery range area during rehearsals for a low-level aerobatic display. Four pilots and two passengers killed.[216]
Air accident 18 km south of Wilkurra Homestead, New South Wales 6 1974 Apr 2 Cessna 310H accident.[217]
Air accident Near Merimbula, New South Wales 6 1976 Feb 29 Piper PA-32 accident.[218]
Air accident Near Kingscote Airport, Kangaroo Island, South Australia 6 1977 May 15 Cessna 210K accident.[219]
Flood Sydney and Penrith, New South Wales 6 1978 Feb–Mar [220]
Air accident Norseman Airport, Norseman, Western Australia 6 1978 Jun 11 Beechcraft D-55 Baron accident.[221]
Air accident Essendon, Victoria 6 1978 Jul 10 Aircraft with a crew of two and one passenger crashed into houses shortly after take off from Essendon Airport. 6 members of one family were killed.[222]
Air accident Near Shepparton, Victoria 6 1979 Aug 30 Cessna P206C accident.[223]
Serial killing Tynong North and Frankston, Victoria 6 1980 Dec Remains found in bushland. Investigation still open.[224][225]
Air accident Koolan Island, Western Australia 6 1984 Dec 23 Cessna 210L accident.[226]
Air accident Near Bankstown Airport, New South Wales 6 1985 Jun 7 Cessna 210N accident.[227]
Flood Hawkesbury, New South Wales 6 1986 Aug Hawkesbury and Georges River Flood.[228]
Air accident Essendon, Victoria 6 1986 Sep 3 Air Ambulance Cessna (call signal RED) crashed on take off from Essendon Airport after single engine failure.[229]
Fire Kings Cross, New South Wales 6 1989 Sep 17 Downunder Hostel fire. Arson attack.[230]
Flood/cyclone Southern Queensland and northern New South Wales 6 1990 Feb Drowning deaths caused by Cyclone Nancy[231]
Rail accident Brooklyn, New South Wales 6 1990 May 6 Commuter train crashed into a stalled chartered steam train.[232]
Air accident Tarago, New South Wales 6 1992 Jun 19 Beechcraft Baron accident.[233]
Air accident Geraldton, Western Australia 6 1992 Aug 25 Beechcraft Baron accident.[234]
